tourBios.curYrHigh: Picked up his first top 10 of the year at the Club Colombia Championship. Hovered near the lead all week and entered the final round four back. Carded a 70 Sunday for a T4.

tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Finished 11-45 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament (exempt to second reshuffle)
tourBios.curYearHigh: Picked up his first top 10 of the year at the Club Colombia Championship. Hovered near the lead all week and entered the final round four back. Carded a 70 Sunday for a T4.
tourBios.carHigh: 2015: Finished T5 at the California Qualifying Tournament, shooting rounds of 70-70-76-71...Blazed through Sunday's round at the PC Financial Open with a 64 on the strength of two eagles, at Nos. 12 and 18...Earned a berth into a five-way playoff with Adam Svensson, Riley Wheeldon, Ross Beal and eventual champion Drew Weaver. Eliminated on the first playoff hole with a par putt for a T2 finish...Finished T10 at the ATB Financial Classic in Calgary...Carded a bogey-free 66 Sunday at the National Capital Open to Support Our Troops to earn a playoff spot with Sam Ryder. Fell victim to Ryder's par putt, with a bogey on the first extra hole...Entered the final round of the Cape Breton Celtic Classic with a share of the lead and missed an eagle putt on the 72nd hole that would have given him the victory...Fell to C.T. Pan's birdie on the second extra hole...Finished T8 at the Freedom 55 Financial Championship to secure third place on the Order of Merit and Web.com Tour status for 2016, along with Freedom 55 Financial Canadian Player of the Year honors and a $25,000 prize...On the Web.com Tour, made five starts and recorded two top-20 finishes, a T13 at the Rust-Oleum Championship and a T19 at the Air Capital Classic, both in June.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Named to first-team All-Mid-American Conference at Kent State as a sophomore in 2011-12...Named MAC Golfer of the Year, first-team All-MAC, MAC Championship medalist and MAC all-tournament team as a junior...Named first-team All-MAC for a third consecutive season as a senior...Qualified as an individual for the 2014 NCAA Championship...One of only two players in Kent State history to play in the NCAA Championship in all four college seasons...Named Co-Mid-American Conference Golfer of the Year with Kent State teammate Corey Conners, who finished runner-up in the 2014 U.S. Amateur.
tourBios.personal: Attended Bayview Secondary School in Richmond Hill, Ontario...Only sister, Jennifer, is one of a few golf course superintendents...Was the MVP in baseball in high school and 2008 Athlete of the Year...Bucket list items include deep-sea fishing and cliff jumping.

tourBios.curYrHigh: Picked up his first top 10 of the year at the Club Colombia Championship. Hovered near the lead all week and entered the final round four back. Carded a 70 Sunday for a T4.
tourBios.carHigh: 2015: Finished T5 at the California Qualifying Tournament, shooting rounds of 70-70-76-71...Blazed through Sunday's round at the PC Financial Open with a 64 on the strength of two eagles, at Nos. 12 and 18 before recording a T2 finish...Finished T10 at the ATB Financial Classic in Calgary...Carded a bogey-free 66 Sunday at the National Capital Open to Support Our Troops to earn a playoff spot with Sam Ryder. Fell victim to Ryder's par putt, with a bogey on the first extra hole...Entered the final round of the Cape Breton Celtic Classic with a share of the lead and missed an eagle putt on the 72nd hole that would have given him the victory...Fell to C.T. Pan's birdie on the second extra hole...Finished T8 at the Freedom 55 Financial Championship to secure third place on the Order of Merit and Web.com Tour status for 2016, along with Freedom 55 Financial Canadian Player of the Year honors and a $25,000 prize...On the Web.com Tour, made five starts and recorded two top-20 finishes.
tourBios.personal: His sister, Jennifer, is the superintendent at Kawartha CC in Ontario...Hopes to play Augusta National someday...Is a a big Toronto Maple Leafs' fan...Dream foursome would include Tiger Woods, Gary Woodland and Dustin Johnson...Twitter is @TaylorPendrith.

tourBios.curYearHigh: Picked up his first top 10 of the year at the Club Colombia Championship. Hovered near the lead all week and entered the final round four back. Carded a 70 Sunday for a T4.

dyn.dynBios: Didn't play competitive golf until age 16.
dyn.dynResults: He has finished 2nd on the Mackenzie Tour-PGA T 3 times.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks 4th in Scoring Average (Actual) on the Mackenzie Tour-PGA TOUR Canada.
